StaticMaps

Class MapsJava

  • java.lang.Object
    • StaticMaps.MapsJava
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StaticMaps

    public abstract class MapsJava
extends java.lang.Object
    It's the kind of which the rest are derived and contains a number of functions and (static) properties mainly for the different options when making requests to the API Google Maps (sensor, language, etc..) And track the status each request.
    Author:
    Luis Marcos

        public static java.lang.String APIkeyCheck(java.lang.String key)
        Check if the developer key is valid Google Maps API.
        Parameters:
        key - ckey Google Maps API Developer
        Returns:
        deturns the status of a request API key. If valid, returns       * "OK" in any other case the key is not correct.

      • setSensor

        public static void setSensor(java.lang.Boolean aSensor)
        Sets the use or non-use of a GPS (GNSS) sensor on requests for location (by default false)
        Parameters:
        aSensor - should be true, it is forced to use sensor. If false, not used
        See Also:
        getSensor()

      • getStockRequest

        public static java.lang.String[][] getStockRequest()
        Get log of all HTTP requests made. Forms a String [n] [6] with the following structure: [0][0]="Request Number" [0][1]="Date / Time request" [0][2]="status request" [0][3]="Requested URL" [0][4]="Information request made" [0][5]=""Exceptions generated" Types of status: OK: indicates that the API request was successful.
        Returns:
        returns a two dimensional array with the different requests made.

      • getLastRequestRequest

        public static java.lang.String[] getLastRequestRequest()
        Get the latest log HTTP request. Forms a String [6] with the following structure: [0]="Request Number" [1]="Date / time request" [2]="status request" [3]="Requested URL" [4]="Information request made" [5]="Exceptions generated" Types of status: OK: ndicates that the API request was successful.
        Returns:
        array of one dimension with the last request made
        See Also:
        getStockRequest()

      • getLastRequestStatus

        public static java.lang.String getLastRequestStatus()
        Gets the status of the last call made. Types of status: OK: indicates that the API request was successful.
        Returns:
        returns string with state last request.
        See Also:
        getStockRequest()

      • getLastRequestURL

        public static java.lang.String getLastRequestURL()
        Returns URL associated with the last call made.
        Returns:
        returns string with the last request URL (for example: "http://maps.google.com/maps/api/geocode/xml?address=Madrid®ion=es&language=es&sensor=false").
        See Also:
        getStockRequest()

      • getLastRequestInfo
